channel.title: MAG
channel.description: Anyone looking forward to this game? I just played the beta and even tho u can only play with up to 64 people, I have to say that things got pretty intense, I can't even imagine what its gonna be like with 256 people. Anyone who doesn't know, MAG stands for Massive Action Game. Its a PS3 exclusive coming out on the 26th and its a multiplayer FPS that boasts up to 256 people battles. Featuring huge maps, vehicles, huge selection of weapons, intense visuals, chain of command (squad leader all the way up to officer in command), robust leveling system, unlockables, extensive weapon upgrade system, and much more this game looks like it will take multiplayer FPS to whole new scale.

item.title: MAG
item.dc:creator: Master_Chef
item.description:
Siggs:

sorry to be Off Topic, but the Halo autoaim, is it on all the time? I was palying Halo3 campain at christmas on legendary and heroic, I can’t say I noticed it at all.
.

It’s pretty noticable. When I was attempting to get the Annual acheivment (4players finish the last level in Ghosts on Legendary with Iron Skull), someone would always veer off the edge of the cliff because the autoaim would steer your vehicle into enemy infantry.

Read full topic

item.title: MAG
item.dc:creator: Ibanez
item.description:
Tmaned:

If you get behind someone and start running after them, you don’t even have to move the joystick to keep your view on them. Probably because you’re going to reach up to the B button and kill them with a lethal tap on the back. I guess it makes sense, since you probably also couldn’t move the stick fast enough to follow someone at close range.

Actually, I think Halo was the game that introduced the auto-aim we see today in most console games.

Pfch, default. I use green thumb, it’s for real men. Melee is tied to pressing the right stick down. Makes it a lot easier to aim and punch at the same time.

Read full topic

item.title: MAG
item.dc:creator: taylor-madeak
item.description:
ColMirage:

Planetside did it. And it rocked for a few years. The game’s still running, AFAIK there’s still more players in the game than a full MAG game could ever dream of, but it’s nowhere where it used to stand.

Planetside was far more than just a game, it was an immersive and incredibly fun social experience.

I sorta hoped that’s what MAG would be to some extent, but so far it just feels like “Battlefield times two”.

Planetside “did it” by being a mumorpuger. Fun fact: mumorpugers still lag when you’re part of a group of 200+ people all blowing shit up at the same time!

Read full topic

item.title: MAG
item.dc:creator: Master_Chef
item.description:
I want this game to do well, but I was dissapointed in the trailers and demos I’ve seen of it. In a game with 256 players, gameplay should be realistic, but what I’ve seen seems very arcadey and run-and gun. Also, this one of the only games I’ve seen where the models and animations are so horrible that I might not play it.

Read full topic

item.title: MAG
item.dc:creator: Tmaned
item.description:
Siggs:
  1. Since when did Halo have strong autoaim? I’ve never noticed anything of the sort when playing
    .

If you get behind someone and start running after them, you don’t even have to move the joystick to keep your view on them. Probably because you’re going to reach up to the B button and kill them with a lethal tap on the back. I guess it makes sense, since you probably also couldn’t move the stick fast enough to follow someone at close range.

Actually, I think Halo was the game that introduced the auto-aim we see today in most console games.

Read full topic

item.title: MAG
item.dc:creator: ColMirage
item.description:
Tmaned:

I think the whole ‘shit ton of players’ thing was already tried out on the PC.

Didn’t work too well. There’s probably no way that it would work on a console.

Planetside did it. And it rocked for a few years. The game’s still running, AFAIK there’s still more players in the game than a full MAG game could ever dream of, but it’s nowhere where it used to stand.

Planetside was far more than just a game, it was an immersive and incredibly fun social experience.

I sorta hoped that’s what MAG would be to some extent, but so far it just feels like “Battlefield times two”.

Read full topic

item.title: MAG
item.dc:creator: Surplus
item.description:
The only ps3 game i’ve ever wanted a pc port for. I mean it seems big at first and all but the way the showed even just the map shows, that although the map has 256 players you will only experience 30-60 of those at any given time. But thats probably a good thing it’d probably get sorta spammy. I also have a feeling map design is going to be very important for this game, and some maps will be played a ton and others left to die a horrible death .

Read full topic

item.title: MAG
item.dc:creator: therandus
item.description:
Someonerandm:

EDIT: This just occurred to me. If you are going to make a game whose only distinguishing feature is that it supports a lot of people, then why would the demo support a lot less people? I feel like they are hiding bad gameplay when lots of people join.

One thats not its only distinguishing feature it has loads more ive played the beta and it is fun, really fun, hard to play at first because its big and confusing but you relise it actually isnt. And Btw they have tested it with 256 players and it works fine, i didnt experience any lag and was very smooth. The maps are huge so its not just a spawn and die game. The rank system which enables commands and objective to be set for a platoon or squad is awsome too. In the beta it wasnt used much but that was only because it was beta and to give orders you need a high rank but the game wasnt playing for long so not many people could achieve that rank. I played COD6 and the BC 2 Beta and even though they are awsome games theres something about MAG that makes it enjoyable, i was sad when the beta ended . i am so gonna get this game.
And who says that there wont be enough players?? lol theres were too many people wanting to play the beta and actually theres are WAY more people with a ps3 now almost everyone i know thats a gamer owns a ps3 so thats not a prob. and woo this game experience and spec system is cool, and whoop vehicles too.
i think this game is very realistic with its gameplay and graphics considoring the players it holds. I’ve only played one type of mode on the beta because i joined late but that was awsome and some of the other features look awsome too.

However i dont think all people will like this game, if you just like going off on your own and getting kills then sure you can do that but defies the point of the game to use teamwork which also means that everyone that plays this game should probably have a headset if they want to have a say in the orders but you can still play it and ahve fun that way, i did . When your together as a team and a bunch of guys have your cornered its awsome when one of your guys goes down and with give the medic covering fire while he revives and give him first aid and getting him back to your squad .

Anyway personally for me its pure epicness!

PS. COD and BC2 are awsome too no doubt about it

Read full topic

item.title: MAG
item.dc:creator: shram
item.description:
Mango Assassin:

since birth.
when your next on it, have 2 people in one match one standing still with aim on someone, then the other person moving in front, youll see theres a lock-on, this only occurs when the recticle is red. and can drag your aim alot.

that rarely happens though, but when it happens it is blatant and highly annoying.

CoDMW2 has disorientations from that at times (some enemy runs past you and you hit the knife, doing a 270 spin because of lock on).

Read full topic

item.title: MAG
item.dc:creator: Mango_Assassin
item.description:
JohnKiller118:

The PC is without a doubt the best interface for FPS/TPS/RTS games, but I find the controller to work just fine. It depends on how well the developers make use of sensitivity options. Plus, there’s a “weak auto-aim” feature (ie, not like GTA’s auto aim) that makes aiming slightly easier.
Halo 3, for example, pretty much has perfect aiming controls, and I’d say I’m pretty good at that game when I get into it.

Siggs:

Don’t forget Uncharted either.
.

i dont see what uncharted was all about, its a poorly developed TRU with a combat system that makes link’s awakening’s version on the gameboy respectable.

Read full topic

item.title: MAG
item.dc:creator: Mango_Assassin
item.description:
JohnKiller118:

The PC is without a doubt the best interface for FPS/TPS/RTS games, but I find the controller to work just fine. It depends on how well the developers make use of sensitivity options. Plus, there’s a “weak auto-aim” feature (ie, not like GTA’s auto aim) that makes aiming slightly easier.
Halo 3, for example, pretty much has perfect aiming controls, and I’d say I’m pretty good at that game when I get into it.

halo 3’s auto-aim was ridiculous, modern warfare 2 has some but not loads. can sometimes be annoying, when it comes to multiplayer all aim assists should be removed, but still its not unfair play if everyone has it. :retard:

item.title: MAG
item.dc:creator: Siggs
item.description:
Mango Assassin:

…although ps3 have only had one respectable exclusive and that was MGS4.

just makes me wonder if they’ll make a big game.

I’m not a PS3 fanboy, but even I know that’s not true. Off the top of my head, Killzone was pretty big, as was the wonderful Little Big Planet. Don’t forget Uncharted either. I’m sure there are more, but I can’t remember them
.
